fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When trying to load the Insight widget in a company-managed board, it won't load showing the error below:

!image-2021-08-16-12-02-33-408.png|width=268,height=173!

This happens if the JQL for the board's filter is referring to the project ID instead of project KEY.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a company-manage board
 # Configure the board's filter to take the project ID, instead of key. E.g:
 {code:java}
 project = 10037 ORDER BY Rank ASC   {code}

h3. Expected Results
The Insight widget should work fine despite the ID being used instead of the key. For saved filters, Jira replaces the project KEY with the ID when the project key changes so that it doesn't break existing filters.
h3. Actual Results

The widget won't load, showing the same error as when the user doesn't have the "View aggregated data" permission in the project
h3. Workaround

Replace the project ID with its KEY in the filter.
fields.summary: Insight widget doesn't load if board's JQL refers to project ID instead of KEY

fields.description:

h3. Environment


h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Navigate to the issue navigator page in Jira Cloud
# Use any of the custom JQL search with the "Parent Link" keyword - 
 e.g {code:sql}
 project in <> and type in <> and "Parent Link" is EMPTY  {code}
# Page will retun an error
 !Issue Navigator.png|thumbnail!

JQL should return the result as expected

An error is thrown- "An unknown error occurred while trying to perform a search"

h3. Workaround

* Sometimes the search operation works on re-try. 

h3. Notes
fields.summary: When using JQL with "Parent Link" is EMPTY is throwing an error in JQL

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Advanced Roadmaps Showing "1" Change to Review but No Changes.

The customer keeps getting the Review = 1 as you can see in the screenshots but they do not have anything for review. The was a Bug created for the same behavior/discrepancy and the solution was implemented but the customer still has the same issue.
 !Screenshot 2021-11-02 at 5.54.22 PM.png|thumbnail! 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
# In a plan, create a dependency between two issues as a scenario change
# Create any scenario change for any issue that is not one of the issues above
# Remove one of the issues out of plan resource (other project) from step 1

h3. Expected Results
The change for review should show 0. No changes

h3. Actual Results
It will leave 1 change for review if the custom field is a multi-value. The Advance Roadmaps continue indicating 1 change for review.

h3. Workaround
The best workaround is... commit something for that field that forces it to show up as a change, commit it... then clear the field... commit the clear. It's going to add to the ticket history but... at least it will get rid of the yellow label on the button. Another way is just to delete the scenario and start a new one.
fields.summary: Advanced Roadmaps Showing "1" Change to Review but No Changes

fields.description:
We frequently  test  our workflows and new configurations.  Many of our workflows have Admin-only buttons .

As an Admin, I would like to  remain logged in –   but   toggle  in-and -out of Admin status in order to see certain   features and buttons, as the  end user would see it.

 

Also,  we  make screen shots for  user-guides and would prefer not to show buttons and features that the end user does not see,

 

The alternative is to log out and log back in with a  non-admin account.   In the course of a testing session, this  might need to happen  multiple times.
fields.summary: Button to allow Admin to toggle between Admin and Non-Admin Status

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Insights in a sprint's board shows completed issues as not yet *Done* if the *Done* status is not in the last (rightmost) column on the board.

Jira business logic defines issues that are in the last column as complete. Any issues that aren’t in the last column on the board will be considered incomplete, irrespective of the status category mapped to that column.

Currently, we can edit the workflow to add multiple statuses in the *Done category* but Jira doesn't use this category to calculate the *Done* status in the Insights data. Instead, it calculates the rightmost column as *Done*.
h3. Suggested Solution

Update Jira's Insights logic where ‘Done’ is based on a status category or workflow and not column position.
h3. Why this is important

Users with workflows that do not have ‘Done’ or ‘Done’ mapped to the last column will not be able to use reports for insights.
h3. Workaround

To mitigate any problems, try this workaround:
 # Go to *Board* > *Manage workflow*.
 # Add the removed Done status to your workflow. Give the status the same name as previously used in your workflow and reports.
 # At this stage, avoid adding any incoming transitions.
 # Save and publish the workflow.
 # From your board, navigate to the More actions (*•••*) > *Board settings*.
 # In *Columns and statuses*, move the Done status to the rightmost column.
 # Hit save.
 # Your reports should behave as before. Add any incoming transitions to the status.

 h3. Other Notes
This is very similar to [JSWCLOUD-15106|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSWCLOUD-15106] except that this one is specific to Insights functionality in the board, while JSWCLOUD-15106 is focusing on the reports logic.
fields.summary: Update Insights Logic where 'Done' is based on a status category or workflow

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

You can convert Sub-tasks to Issues (e.g. Story, Task). That might be necessary after you start a sprint. 

The Burndown chart tracks the issues since the start of the sprint, and add scope change events when issues are added or removed fro the Sprint.

Currently, if you convert a Sub-task to Issue the Burndown chart will add a scope change related to that issue's removal. 

But that's inconsistent because the value for the Sprint remains on the Sprint field even after the Sub-task is converted. 

h3. Update

The same will happen even if the Sub-task is converted prior to the sprint start.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

* Create an issue
* Create a sub-task under that issue
* Create a sprint, add that issue to the sprit and then start it
* Convert the Sub-task to issue:
 !Screen Shot 2021-08-11 at 13.53.14.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Expected Results

Since the Sprint field keeps the value after the conversion, the Burndown chart should not just log the scope change related to the issue's removal.

h3. Actual Results

The only event logged will be the issue's removal even though the sprint value remained on the issue after the conversion was made:
 !Screen Shot 2021-08-11 at 13.55.21.png|thumbnail!  !Screen Shot 2021-08-11 at 13.56.13.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround

After the issue is converted, clear the sprint field and populate it again with the desired sprint. That will then create the scope change with the issue addition.
fields.summary: Inconsistent scope change on Burndown chart when Sub-task is converted to Issue

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Deleting the basic view while users have it selected causes a bug where these users can still see the deleted view but with the name "Untitled" after the deletion and it remains there regardless of cache and cookies.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
1. User with Edit Rights navigates to any Plan.
2. User with Edit Rights selects “Save This view” > “Save as a new
view”
3. User with Edit Rights types a new title in the “Title” field and
checks the checkbox “Make default for everyone”
4. User with Edit Rights deletes a view called “Basic”
5. Any users who had previously been on “Basic” now see a view called
“Untitled” when they go to the Roadmap and it's their default one. 

h3. Expected Results
The view should be deleted for all users and they should default to the one created and marked as default by the admin.

h3. Actual Results

The users who were in the basic view while it was deleted now see the "Untitled" view and it becomes their default one. They can navigate to other valid
views (including the new one that was saved), but by default, instead of
going to the new view that was created by the Admin in Steps 2 & 3 above, the users see the “Untitled” view:

 !Screen Shot 2021-08-10 at 10.32.39.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround

No workaround is available at the moment. 
Even if one of the affected users is given permissions and saves the untitled view with a new name the admin can delete it and it disappears for that user but it remains for the other affected users.
fields.summary: Deleting the basic view while users are using it causes it to remain for those users as "Untitled" after deletion

fields.description: One major piece of functionality that is missing for our teams using Portfolio is that when the end date of a parent ticket gets extended the start dates for dependent tickets don't auto-adjust accordingly. We need the option to have the dates on these dependencies also update.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

On the issue cards in Team-managed projects, the 'Due date' only displays Day and Month, not the Year. This could get confusing when there are issues with the same due dates but with different years. 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 * Add 'Due date' to Team-managed issues
 * Let Issue A have the due date of 10 Aug 2021 and Issue B have the due date of 10 Aug 2022.
 * On the Issue cards of the Team managed project board, both the above issues will be shown to have Due date of 10 Aug. The year is not specified. 

h3. Expected Results

For the Due date, the issue cards on the board should show the complete date including the year.
h3. Actual Results

Only the day and the month are displayed on the issue cards. 

[^Screen Recording 2021-08-09 at 4.39.59 PM.mov]
h3. Workaround


 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: On the issue cards in Team-managed projects, the 'Due date' only displays Day and Month, not the Year.

fields.description:
h3. Problem

If a ticket is not completed in a sprint, the Roadmap (project level not the Advanced Roadmap) doesn't update on the next/additional sprints. The timeline keeps the ticket in the original sprint.

h3. Environment

Jira Software Cloud
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 * Add an Epic and some Stories to a Sprint
 * Start sprint
 * Close some stories in the Sprint, leave some Open/In Progress
 * Close Sprint - move the uncompleted Stories to a new Sprint
 * Go back to Roadmap view

h3. Expected Results

The roadmap timeline should move the uncompleted Stories to the new Sprint.
h3. Actual Results

The Roadmap timeline keeps the stories under the original sprint (even though it's been moved to a new sprint). Manually updating the timeline doesn't save.
h3. Workaround

Advanced Roadmaps
fields.summary: Roadmap: Issues Not Moved to the Next Sprint When Not Completed in First Sprint

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The new {{Insights}} Feature on the Scrum board shows the Estimation data based on the Estimate statistic set for the board (Either Story Points or Time).
 Currently seems like Insights only checks for Story Points on {{Standard Issue}} Types and doesn’t calculate on the {{sub-task}} story point… So if a parent story has no story points and the Sub-tasks does, Insight doesn’t show any progress on the progress bar (Right-hand side of the board).
 Currently, we do not have any ability, to sum up story points from sub-tasks and populate them to its Parent Estimation Field https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSWCLOUD-9167. So it is not possible to populate the Sum of Story Points in The Parent Issue's Story Points as of now.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Enable the Insights Feature for your boards.
 # Create a Sprint and Create a Standard Issue Type with some Sub-Tasks. (For Testing add 2 sub-tasks)
 # Add the Standard Issue to the newly created Sprint and Start the Sprint.
 # Make sure the *Board Settings* > *Estimation* > *Estimation Statistic* is set to "Story Points"

*Scenario 1:*
 * Add some Story Points to Sub-Tasks. Leave the Parent Story Points to Zero.
 * Go to the board and Move only one Sub-Task from "To Do" to "In Progress".
 * At this point Insights should show "Not Started" to be 50% and "In Progress" status to be 50% On Insights, as one sub-task is in "To Do" and the other in "In Progress"
 * Sub-Tasks Story Points are Ignored and Progress Bar Doesn't Update. It stays to be 100% for "Not Started/To Do" and also for "In Progress"
 !image-2021-08-08-01-15-35-145.png|thumbnail!

*Scenario 2:*
 * Add some Story Points to Sub-Tasks. Also Manually add the sum of sub-task Story points to the Parent Issue's Story Points.
 * Go to the board and Move the Parent Issue and only one of the sub-tasks from "To Do" to "In Progress".
 * At this point Insight should show "Not Started" to be 50% and "In Progress" status to be 50% as one sub-task is in "To Do" and the other in "In Progress" for the Parent Issue in the Sprint.
 * Sub-Task Story Points are Ignored and currently only Standard Issue Type Story Points are considered and hence the "Not Started/To Do" is 0% and "In Progress" is 100% in the Progress bar.
 !image-2021-08-08-01-18-57-525.png|thumbnail!

h3. Expected Results

When there are one or more Sub-Tasks under a Parent/Standard Issue Type, Calculate the Insight Statistics with the help of Sub-Task Story Points and not with the Standard Issue Story Points.
h3. Actual Results

Sub-Task Story Points are Ignored when calculating Insights Statistics... Only Parent/Standard Issue Type Story points are taken into account... Hence, when you move one of the 2 sub-task forward on the board, Insights still show no progress.
h3. Workaround
 # No workaround at the moment for Standard Issue Types and Sub-Tasks.
 # *Insights is capable of calculating correctly when the relationship is between Epic and Standard Issue Types.*

h4. {color:#4c9aff}Possible Workaround: (But not complete){color}
 * Create an Automation Rule that sums up all the Sub-Tasks Story Points and adds it to their Parent Story Points field. Add or subtract the parent story point accordingly, when a new sub-task is added or an existing sub-task is removed.
 * Create another automation rule that is when *ALL* the sub-task under a parent move from "To Do" to "In Progress", the parent automatically moves to "In Progress" so that the *Insights* shows 100% when all the Sub-Tasks reach a common Status on the board.
fields.summary: Insights in Jira Software Board doesn't consider Sub-Task's Story point when calculating Sprint Progress Percentage

fields.description:
First of all, thanks you for the workflow editor.
Currently, this workflow editor allows us to define a rule for a transition.

Currently I have a possibility to require certain field to be filled in during the transition:
!image-2021-08-06-20-55-09-884.png!

However, I would like to have way to entice my colleagues to provide at least a modicum of reasoning for the transition they perform. 

h3. Expected result:
A workflow rule(s) should allow to entice users to comment on the transition they perform.

fields.description: There are lots of agile methods that don't use story points.  In fact, I would argue that story points should only be used for Epics.  Please update the Sprint burndown chart to have an option to use Original Estimate and Time Tracking as the basis for the chart.
fields.summary: Sprint Burn Down Chart Only Works off Story Points

fields.description:
Jira is used by developers as well as product people.

Developers are used to using real markdown edit wiki documents etc... but there is no proper markdown support whatsoever in Jira. I have tried many extensions but none of them can seem to do it properly or, if they do, it turns it into what Jira understands and is no longer able to be edited once committed. 
 

Please implement a proper markdown system that knows how to interface bidirectionally with the current WYSIWYG-based editing experience.
fields.summary: Suggestion: Allow for real markdown editing in Jira

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

You can access the Pages section on a project to connect it to a Confluence space.

Currently, if you try accessing that section when you don't have Confluence product access will result in a misleading error message, which gives the idea that there was an error in the application, and even asks you to contact the support:
 !Screen Shot 2021-06-10 at 11.20.58.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Steps to Reproduce

* Log in as a user that does not have Confluence product access
* Try accessing the pages section on a project

*UPDATE (June 18th, 2021):* That message is also displayed when you don't have *Browse Projects* permission in the project. 

h3. Expected Results

The application will state that you need product access to Confluence.

h3. Actual Results

The following error message is displayed:
{code}
We can't display project pages right now
Contact support if refreshing doesn't fix things.
{code}

h3. Workaround

If you have the need to access that section, contact your admins so they can grant you Confluence product access.
fields.summary: Misleading error message when accessing the Pages section on a project

fields.description:
In a board of a company-managed project, when having the issues grouped by Stories, and deleting an issue (by right clicking a card and selecting _Delete_) there is a change in cursor position/focus, this seems intended to take us to the end of the "group" for that Story but can cause confusion when having many sub-tasks under each Story, as depending on the user resolution and web browser zoom level, this change of focus can effectively get users "lost" in the board for a moment and the suggestion is to remove it altogether, so if a user deletes an issue, there is no auto-scrolling on the page nor change of focus.

 !image-2021-08-04-13-35-33-342.png|thumbnail! 
 [^SCRUM01 board - Agile Board - Jira.mp4]
fields.summary: Do not change focus when deleting a task from board

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The inline creation is not available on the boards from Team-managed projects when the setting Allow unassigned issues is OFF, even though the default assignee is NOT unassigned.
h3. Steps to Reproduce

Video available [here|https://share.getcloudapp.com/bLuq6A5z]
 # Go to *Jira Settings* > *System*
 # Check if *Allow unassigned issues* is *OFF*
 ## If it is *ON*, click on *Edit Settings* at the top of the page to update the value to *OFF*
 ## Click on *Update* at the bottom of the page to save the changes
 # Go to any team-managed project Backlog or Board
 # The inline creation of issues is not possible

h3. Expected Results

The inline creation should be available even when *Allow unassigned issues* is *OFF*, as it already happens for company-managed projects:

!Team Managed Scrum - Agile board - Jira 2021-08-03 at 5.30.54 PM-1.jpg|width=213,height=252!

!TMK board - Agile board - Jira 2021-08-03 at 5.34.02 PM.jpg|width=299,height=252!
h3. Actual Results

The inline creation is not available in team-managed projects:

!OFF - Team Managed Scrum - Agile board - Jira 2021-08-03 at 5.37.39 PM.jpg|width=261,height=252!

!OFF - TMK board - Agile board - Jira 2021-08-03 at 5.38.11 PM.jpg|width=346,height=252!
h3. Workaround - set Allow unassigned issues back to ON

Set the *Allow unassigned issues* back to *ON*
 # Go to *Jira Settings* > *System*
 # Click on *Edit Settings* at the top of the page
 # Look for *Allow unassigned issues* and update the value to *ON*
 # Click on *Update* at the bottom of the page to save the changes

h3. Additional workaround - create issues by clicking in the Create button

Create the issues as usual, by clicking in the *Create* button on the top of the page.
fields.summary: Inline card creation disabled when Allow unassigned issues is OFF and default assignee is NOT Unassigned for Team-managed projects

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Removing an issue from a Sprint and adding it back already on 'In Progress' status shows it as "Issues completed outside of this sprint" even when moving to Done before the Sprint's end.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create an issue and assign it to a Sprint (already started or to start).
 # Remove this issue from the Sprint.
 # Move it to the 'In Progress' status.
 # Add it back to the Sprint.
 # Move the issue to Done.
 # Complete the Sprint.
 # You will see the it showing as Completed Issues on the closing Sprint Screen.

h3. Expected Results

Issue shown as *"Completed on the Sprint"* on the Sprint Report.
h3. Actual Results

Issue shown as *"Issues completed outside of this sprint"* on the Sprint Report.
h3. Workaround

None.
fields.summary: Removing and re-adding an issue in a Sprint shows it as "Issues completed outside of this sprint"

fields.description:
Checked existing, not reported.

In manage addons in cloud. Application history is kept for 90 days. Which is a very short period for a log file.

Some clients, particularly anyone financial require the ability to check who has installed an App or updated an application. Could we extend the log retention point from 90 days too 9 years?

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Software Cloud*. Using *JIRA Software Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSWSERVER-11160].
  {panel}

Updated summary - was "Add "Disable Detail View" option to Agile Board User Preferences"

---

As a developer, I would like to NOT have the detail view pop-up when selecting a card on an Agile board so that I don't loose screen real-estate by showing details I don't want to see, because I typically open the issue in a new browser tab to see all of the details and/or make edits anyway.

As a SCRUM Master, I would like the detail view to display so that I don't have to continuously open new tabs to view each issue when discussing issues as a team in the daily standup.

As can be seen, the role of the user plays a significant part in how this feature is typically used.  The proposed "solution" is to make the display of the detail a USER PREFERENCE that can be enabled or disabled per board (either Kanban or Scrum)

Similar to GHS-10182 - however, that request wanted to make it an ADMIN function to disable the detail view per board, which does not fit with a sub-set of users.
fields.summary: Ability to select issues without the Detail View opening

fields.description:
h3. *Problem*

When a team-managed project is created via API, the features are not enabled, so it's necessary to access the project via UI and enable it.

The REST API available on the [documentation|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/software/rest/api-group-board/#api-agile-1-0-board-boardid-features-put] doesn't work for this type of project:
{code:java}
curl --request PUT \
  --url 'https://your-domain.atlassian.net/rest/agile/1.0/board/{boardId}/features' \
  --header 'Accept: application/json' \
  --header 'Content-Type: application/json' \
  --data '{
  "boardId": 2154,
  "feature": "<string>",
  "enabling": true
}'
{code}
h3. *Suggestion*

Add the ability to use this endpoint to enable and disable next-gen/team-managed features.
fields.summary: Ability to enable/disable features in team-managed projects via REST API

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Regenerating the OAth token with Github Enterprise setup from DVCS page might result in the below error. This error could be misleading at times if the configuration is not working even after multiple tries. If the repos are getting synced with after this operation then the OAth token has been generated successfully.
 !DVCS Error message.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Login to GitHub Enterprise as a user with admin permissions on the account.
# Navigate to Settings > Developer settings > OAuth apps.
#  Select your OAuth app.
# On your app page, click Revoke all user tokens to remove all old user tokens for this application.
# Click Generate a new client secret.
# Copy the new client secret and then delete the old client secret.
#  Go to the DVCS accounts page in Jira.
# Click the More options (•••) menu next to your existing GitHub Enterprise account or workspace.
# Select Reset OAuth settings.
# Paste the existing Client ID as Key and the new client secret as Secret to regenerate the access token.

h3. Expected Results
DVCS should confirm that the Oath token has been generated successfully.
h3. Actual Results
 !DVCS Error message.png|thumbnail! 
h3. Workaround

* Verify if the Sync is working fine, then the setup has been configured perfectly.
* Contact support if you need any more clarification.
fields.summary: Reseting OAuth settings for Github Enterprise from DVCS page ends up with an error message

fields.description:

fields.summary: As a user I'd like the Jira deployments tab to display all related environment deployments

fields.description:

fields.description:
Hi,

 

Would it be possible to implement a "Next" button within the child issue screen? At the moment, when you want to update several sub tasks within a task (to add comments or change dates for example), you have to go into each one of them, update, then go back a page, onto the next etc. This can be time consuming when you have quite a lot of sub tasks. A button that would take you to the next sub-task within that specific task could save a lot of that time.
fields.summary: Adding a "Next" button to child issues view.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

In the New issue, View can create more Subtasks straight under Epic via + if created one subtask via Old issue view.
 This bug happens because of JSWCLOUD-18722: On the Old Issue View, a Subtask can be created under an Epic
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # View the Epic in the Old issue view
 # Under ... on top right hand select Creare Sub-task
 # Switch to New issue View
 # Under Subtasks + option to add more subtasks

h3. Expected Results

 As it is documented should not be able to create subtask straight under Epic
 * [JIRA Software: Hierarchy - Evaluator Resources - Atlassian Documentation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confeval/jira-software-evaluator-resources/jira-software-hierarchy]

h3. Actual Results

Can create subtasks under Epic if follow above steps
h3. Workaround

Don't create any subtasks under Epic
fields.summary: In the New issue View can create more Subtasks straight under Epic if created subtask via old issue view

fields.description: When we complete a sprint and start the next, people are FLOODED with email notifications. Can we please have an option to send/not sent email notifications? Like when your bulk update tickets. Thanks!
fields.summary: Sprint Close Notifications

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Deleting a priority when a board uses priorities as card colors will cause the deleted priority to still show with its ID but no name in the board settings.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Configure a board to use priorities as card colors
# Create a new priority and see it appear in the board settings
# Delete the priority from the Jira settings > Issues > priorities page
# Return to the board settings. The priority remains but without a name and only its ID and color 

h3. Expected Results
The priority should disappear from all the pages where it was referenced upon deletion

h3. Actual Results
The priority remains with only its ID and color in the board settings even when it doesn't appear in the system settings

 !Screen Shot 2021-07-26 at 11.38.17.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround
The priority can be manually deleted from each board where it was referenced.
fields.summary: Deleting a priority when a board uses priorities as card colors will cause the deleted priority to still show with its ID in the board settings

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Sprint-related reports do not keep historical if the statuses are no longer available. This means that if the status is removed from the board by unmapping it or if the workflow changes, it will impact the commitment and complete information in the reports.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Get a completed Sprint where the Velocity Chart has a commitment and completed data;
 # Edit the project workflow to use only different statuses and map them on the board.
 # Check the Velocity Chart.

_**Similar impact can be seen also on the Sprint report._
h3. Expected Results

The commitment and completion will change.
h3. Actual Results

The report should keep historical information.
h3. Workaround

As a workaround, in the new workflow we must ensure that all the previous statuses are included, but without transitions to it. This will allow the report to use the status data for historical purposes while will prevent users to accidentally transition issues to unused status.
fields.summary: Sprint-related reports do not keep historical if the statuses are no longer available

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
503 error experienced while opening boards in software and business projects

h3. Steps to Reproduce

 # Access the board. The board does not load and 503 error is experienced

h3. Expected Results
The board should load as expected
 !Screenshot 2021-07-26 at 14.27.18.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Actual Results
The board does not load

h3. Workaround
 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: 503 error experienced while opening boards in software and business projects

fields.description:

fields.description:
h3. Request

The request is to have such a gadget that displays closed issues count in a percentage view. For instance, a user was assigned 50 cases and out of those 50, the user closes 45 issues, which means the completion percentage for the user is 90% in that sprint.

h3. Suggestion

We can achieve this by use of multiple filters and then using each of those filters in different "Issue Statistics" gadgets.

Step1: Configure a filter like _project = AUT AND assignee in (<one assignee>) ORDER BY created DESC_. Repeat the same for other assignees.

Step2: Use each of these filters in *Issue Statistics* gadget with a configuration like below.

 !Image 2021-07-14 at 5.27.14 PM.jpg|thumbnail! 

Step3: After configuring all the gadgets, we should have something like this

 !Image 2021-07-14 at 5.28.22 PM.jpg|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Request for a Dashboard Gadget that should display the issues closed by a user in a percentage view

When there is a self-transition to a status it is visible on the main issue page :

!image-2021-07-23-14-15-08-308.png|width=402,height=96!

b) Sub-tasks Window :

!image-2021-07-23-14-17-29-623.png|width=533,height=94!
h3. Suggested Solution :

Include self transition tabs next to linked issues and sub-tasks similar to the option available on main issue

_Open the linked issue / sub-task separately and then do a self-transition_

fields.description:

Company managed boards allows starting two sprints from team managed boards

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a Classic board and display 2 team managed sprints
 # Close one and start the other
 # Reopen the closed one
 # Team managed board won't load

h3. Expected Results
Classic board doesn't allow reopening a sprint if there's an active on source board (and it's team managed).

h3. Actual Results
Company managed boards allow parallel sprint on team managed boards

h3. Workaround
Close one of the sprints using the company managed board. If the team managed board doesn't load it may be necessary to clean the browser cache.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Using the plan's built-in search function, it will disable drag and drop - limiting the ability the moving issues around within the plan for ranking.

The search needs to be cleared before drag and drop is possible again.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Go to any plan
# Perform a search matching any string from the issues (no result search will not trigger this bug)

h3. Expected Results

While the search result being highlighted, it shouldn't block the ability to rank issues by drag and drop.

h3. Actual Results

Issues can't be dragged and dropped.

h3. Workaround

If at all possible, use *Filters* to create a smaller size of issues on the plan's view to enable easier visual search.
fields.summary: Plan built-in search disables drag and drop of issues

fields.description: Availability to use due date field in smart values for Jira Automation rules
fields.summary: Availability to use due date field in smart values for Jira Automation rules

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The feature of "Print Cards" isn't triggering the print event.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Go to any board
 # On the three dots menu (...) select "*Print Cards*"
 # Click on "*Print*" or any other button (e.g Card layout)

h3. Expected Results

The print wizard should be triggered.
h3. Actual Results

No action is performed and no error is shown in the UI or in the browser's console.
h3. Workaround


 Currently, the available workaround is to use the browser's print feature (Right-click on the page > Print")

fields.description:
I am a Product Owner for various scrum teams and part of my role requires me to review the sub-tasks on stories (for various reasons). 

To do this today, I have to either open the sub-tasks in separate tabs in my browser, or else I have to click into a subtask, click back to the parent task, scroll, and then click on the next subtask.

I would find it very helpful if I could have "next" and "previous" buttons on the sub-task view instead, so that I can easily click through the sub-tasks within the active issue (perhaps in a similar fashion to the way I can view "next" and "previous" issues in the issue filter).
fields.summary: Make it easy to view "next" or "previous" Sub-tasks on a Standard task

fields.description:
My team often uses the backlog view, where we have different sprint/groups.

(E.g.: current and next sprints for each squad, overall Staging, overall Backlog)

Some of those lists are really long.

!1 - Top of page.png|width=513,height=346,thumbnail!

 

Often when we are scrolling we completely lose sight of where we are.

Are we looking at staging? Or at the backlog already?

This is especially troublesome when we are changing filters and the lengths of the lists change.

!2- Current scrolling.png|width=533,height=360,thumbnail!

 

It would be really helpful if the titles of these sections were sticky while we are scrolling, this way we'd always know what we're looking at. Something along these lines:

   !3- Suggestion.png|width=514,height=347,thumbnail!
fields.summary: Backlog view - make sprint title sticky

fields.description:

 * Reposition tooltip so that it doesn't cover the button
 * Do not show the tooltip at all if I wrote the right format
 ** Maybe just show the message if the user tries to submit without adding the proper time unit (as a validation of the field, rather than a tooltip)

 

!image-2021-07-21-13-59-37-188.png|width=327,height=276!

We can see an example of the current behavior here: [^NXTSCRUM board - Agile board - Jira.mp4]

fields.description:
h3. Problem Statement:

For issues created via the Issue Collector form, the reporter isn't updated on the progress of the issue moving forward.
h3. Suggested Solution:

It would be nice to have the reporter added as a watcher or some sort of subscriber to get news about the progress of the issue.

The issue created via Issue Collector saves the e-mail address inside the Description field of the issue so it's not possible to fetch it or create automation with this info.

When there are many sprints, move a recently created sprint to the top using this option takes a lot of time and needs lots of clicks and user interaction.

Adding an option to move a sprint to the top would improve a lot the usability in that case.

fields.description:
{panel:title= Implementation of New Features Policy|titleBGColor=#e0efff}
(i)
At the moment, we can't set an ETA for this feature to be released, since there's a number of factors that determine how our product team prioritizes new features. Consider adding yourself as a watcher to be kept informed as to the state of this feature request moving forward. With that way, if our development team updates the ticket, you'll be notified via email.
 You can learn more by reading [Implementation of New Features Policy|https://confluence.atlassian.com/support/implementation-of-new-features-policy-201294576.html].
{panel}
h3. Problem Definition

Currently, Jira collapses user avatars and only shows four or fewer profile pictures even when there is space to render more. This behavior is probably based on [Avatar Stack - AtlasKit|https://developer.atlassian.com/platform/forge/ui-kit-components/avatar-stack/].

 !avatar-stack-preview.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Suggested Solution

Expand avatar stack corresponding to the rendering space.
h3. Workaround

None. Consider adding yourself as a watcher to be kept informed as to the state of this feature request moving forward. With that way, if our development team updates the ticket, you'll be notified via email.
fields.summary: Expand the avatar-stack when there is space to render

fields.description:
The process of:

1. Submit suggestion in ticket
2. Have your suggestion get erroneously closed because an admin didn't understand that it was different than a similar-sounding suggestion
3. Voting for a close-enough suggestion that could result in a workaround
4. Leaving a comment explaining why this functionality is important to your organization
5. Spending years waiting for tickets to "gather interest" while getting regularly reminded via additional comments that your request is being ignored
6. Finally getting the good news that your suggestion will be implemented, but that it will either:

A) Only be implemented for cloud (when you're on sever... or vice-versa)
B) Only be implemented for next-gen (when you're using classic, because next-gen lacks features that classic has... or vice-versa)
or
C) Be rolled into a new ticket that combines multiple years-old suggestions, and now has the "gathering interest" process start over again from zero.

Honestly - and I really do mean this with all sincerity - please just stop.

Stop offering us a "voice" if you have no intention to listen to that voice.  

I honestly would rather just hear what you plan to do, because I can make decisions with that information.  Allowing me to make a request and then putting me in a years-long circling pattern forces me to choose between being paralyzed by a lack of response, or abandoning Jira in favor of someone who actually communicates with their customers.

We have started the process of evaluating competitive products, and are finding some really kinda snappy alternatives.  Most of our studio has been using Jira for years, so transitioning would be expensive and disruptive, but honestly, the lack of consistent implementation of functionality and reliance on hit-or-miss 3rd party developers to fill obvious gaps in your product doesn't leave me with a lot of choice.

Please figure it out.  Thank you.

P.S. If you're going to make me choose a component to provide feedback, please create an "Other" or "General Feedback" component.  This is basic stuff.
fields.summary: Stop using Jira for suggestions

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

There is a discrepancy in the behavior of the Release option.
h3. Steps to Reproduce

*Observation:*

*1. Release from the Board:*

Creating a New Version from the board will release all the issues in the rightmost column, even if the resolution is not set.

*2. Release from Project menu > Releases > (...) > Release:* Will show that all issues in Done status will be Released. If the resolution is not set for the completed issues, the issues will not be released. Incorrect information is shown about the number of issues that'll be released.
{panel}
With further testing we noticed releasing issues using *Release from Project menu > Releases > (...) > Release* depends on whether there are any issues in the status other than Done Category.

*Steps to reproduce this issue:*

*_With no resolution set and having a few incomplete issues:_*
 # Create a Release version (say V1) in the project: Releases > Create version
 # Ensure Resolution is not added to the *Done* status
 # Add this release as a Fix version to a few issues, move a few of them to *Done* status, and leave a few issues in *In progress* or any other status
 # Create another version, say V2
 # Release V1 and move the unresolved issues to V2

*Result:*

No issues will be released, but the prompt showed the issues in Done status will be released.
 [^Release - issues in progress.mov]

 

*_With no resolution set and all issues moved to Done Status:_*
 # Move all the issues to Done status
 # Release V2

*Result:*
 All the issues will be released.

[^Release - all issues in done status.mov] 

 

*The issue is reproducible:*
 Only when resolution is not set for the statuses belonging to Done Category and there are unresolved issues in the current release.

*The issue is not reproducible:*
 # When the resolution is set for the statuses belonging to Done Category and if there are unresolved issues
 # When the resolution is *NOT* set for the statuses belonging to Done Category and if there are no unresolved issues in the release.

*Workaround:*

Use Release Hub to release the version 
 # Run a search query that will bring all issues in the Done column that needs to be released
 # Bulk edit them to set a resolution.
 OR
 # Create a post-function on your workflow on the Close/Done transition to the "Update field" to set a proper resolution
 # Run a search query that will bring all issues released and bulk transition then through this status again.{panel}
 

*3. Release from Release Hub > Release:* This will show only the issues with the resolution set as the issues that will be released. All the completed issues without resolution will be shown as Unresolved.
[^Release Hub.mov]
h3. Expected Results

Release from Project menu > Releases > (...) > Release and Release from Release Hub > Release should show the same results
h3. Actual Results

There is a discrepancy in the behavior of the Release option
h3. Workaround

Always release version from Release Hub to know the right details of the issues that'll be released. Ensure resolution is set to the statuses mapped to the Done column.
fields.summary: The discrepancy in the behavior of the Release option

fields.description:
When editing issues the new issue UI uses the new Confluence-style editor UI.

TODO fill the description.

It's kinda a bad experience.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When clicking on future sprint, it takes to Active Sprint board in Team-managed project

h3. Steps to Reproduce
1. Go to Issue and update the sprint field with any Future Sprint
2. Click on the Future sprint hyperlink, it takes to the Active Sprint.

It takes to Active Sprint view.

fields.description:
Problem

After configuring an integration between OpsGenie and Jira Software, it's possible to automatically create a Jira ticket when an alert is created, but it will only show the issue key on OpsGenie.

fields.summary: Do Not allow "Done" epics to be assigned as parent issue to jira stories in Team Managed project.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Whenever you create multiple contexts for a custom field that are applied to different projects if you create a plan selecting only one of these projects as an issue source, Advanced Roadmaps for Jira will display all of the custom field options available for the field, regardless of the context associated with the project.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a *Select List (single choice)* custom field.
 # Configure multiple contexts for this custom field, as in the screenshot below:
 !Screen Shot 2021-01-11 at 18.20.40.png|thumbnail! 
 # Add the created custom field to your plan (*Cog Icon* > *Configure* > *Custom Fields* > *Add custom field* > Select the correct custom field and click on *Add 1 field*).
 # Navigate back to the plan, insert a value for the custom field in one of the issues (you will notice that the context is respected).
 !Screen Shot 2021-01-11 at 18.53.47.png|thumbnail! 
 # Click on the *Filters* button, locate the custom field inserted and click on the dropdown menu associated with it. 

h3. Expected Results

* Only the options associated with the context being used will be displayed.

h3. Actual Results

* All custom field options are displayed. Additionally, if multiple contexts display the same option, they will all be listed, but users will not be able to differentiate them.

 !Screen Shot 2021-01-11 at 18.54.11.png|thumbnail! 
h3. Workaround

* Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior other than using independent custom fields instead of multiple contexts in a single one. A workaround will be added here when available.
fields.summary: Plan filters include custom field options that are not relevant to the plan's sources context

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When the view is set to group by teams and the capacity is displayed in the timeline, if the date range is changed for the timeline view the team capacity changes when a week is completely in view vs when it is partially visible due to the dates selected.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Set the view to group issues by team and display the team capacity in the timeline.
# Assign issues to the team so that the week shows the capacity usage.
# Change the time range displayed in the timeline so the week when the work was assigned is completely visible.
# Then change the date ranges forward so that the same week is partially covered at the beginning of the timeline. The team capacity will show that more hours were assigned for the same week.

h3. Expected Results
The assigned hours should not change regardless of the displayed dates.

h3. Actual Results
The number of assigned hours in the timeline increases when the week where they were assigned is partially visible.

h3. Workaround
 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Changing the date range in the roadmap timeline view modifies the capacity displayed for a team

fields.description: For instance when looking at an active sprint, our team regularly picks each user and goes over their tasks. In order to only have a single assignee's issue list in the border the scrum master has to deselect the previous assignee and select a new assignee as we move down the line. The request is to add modifier+click control (i.e. ctrl+click) that automatically deselects any/all selected assignees in the list and select specifically the modifer+clicked assignee.
fields.summary: Allow modifier+clicking on assignee list for toggling list to single assignee

fields.description:

h3. Environment

Boards
 .
h3. Steps to Reproduce

 # You will see Everything else on the top

Everything else swimlane should be on the bottom
h3. Actual Results

Everything else swimlane at the top

h3. Notes

fields.description:

---

The next time I opened the issue, the editor was open and my changes were there. 
Assuming that I had just opened the editor by mistake – as it works simply by clicking in the text – but had not changed anything, I instinctively clicked on "Cancel" and all my changes were gone.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Using Checkbox field in board filter can cause more projects to be included than intended

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a checkbox custom field.
 # Go to a software Board and in the board filter add the checkbox field in a similar way to this: {code}(project = <project key> OR "Checkbox custom field [Checkboxes]" in (<Any value>)) AND <any other criteria> ORDER BY <fields> DESC, Rank ASC
{code}
h3. Expected Results
The board just considers the issues (and their projects) included in the result as part of the board, and the versions that show up in the list of versions correspond to the projects from the issues included in the filter results.

h3. Actual Results
The board will include all the projects the user can browse in the board, even when they are nowhere to be seen in the filter results, and all the versions from those projects will appear in the Versions panel in the backlog.

h3. Workaround
There is no workaround available at the moment. one will be added when one is available.
fields.summary: Using Checkbox field in board filter can cause more projects to be included than intended

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When pasting the URL of a board that is using the Only My Issues quick filter, it's removing the other assignee's quick filter.

Reproducing the bug:  [^onlyMyIssuesBug.mp4] 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Open a Scrum board.
 # Select the *Only My Issues* quick filter on the active board.
 # Copy the URL and paste it and go on a new tab

h3. Expected Results
The board should display only your issues and all available assignees.

h3. Actual Results
The board should display only your issues and hide all other available assignees


h3. Workaround
Just refresh the page.
fields.summary: Only My Issues is vanishing the assignee quick filter

fields.description:
Currently, when completing a Sprint provide a report with the details of all the issues that will be sent to the next sprint. The suggestion is that it would be helpful to have the issues that are on each "bucket" (completed, issues not yet complete that will be sent to the next sprint including its status visible).

This would help less back and fort between the sprint report and the boards.
fields.summary: When completing a Sprint provide a report with the details of all the issues that will be sent to the next sprint

fields.description:
Add support for self-hosted GitLab instance in automation.
Currently, when a self-hosted GitLab instance is connected to Jira, automation shows the error: "No Git provider connected". Improve the error message to show self-hosted GitLab instances are not supported.

It is important to clarify that the part that is unsupported is the connection through DVCS.
fields.summary: Add support for self hosted/on-premise GitLab instance in automation and improve the error message

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Currently, when moving an issue that is existing in a sprint to another scrum project, It would create the same sprint in the destination project with the same name when the sprint is completed or deleted even by mistake it would be deleted in both the source and destination projects. (It is a softlink of the source project basically).
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create two scrum projects. (A and B)
 # Create a sprint named sprint 1 in project A 
 # Create an issue in project A under sprint 1
 # Move the issue to project B using the bulk operation 

You will see that the project B has sprint 1 created and the issue under it. when deleting the sprint 1 in project B will delete the sprint 1 in project A.
h3. Expected Results

The option to choose a sprint that exists in the destination project or atleast a warning should be there stating that the same sprint will be created in the destination project
h3. Actual Results

Nothing appears, the issue moves to the new project.
h3. Workaround

When moving from project A to B, remove the sprint field value and initiate the move operation. so that the issue will reach the backlog section of the destination project.
fields.summary: Option to change the sprint during move operation

fields.description:
Currently there exists the ability to GET quick filters via REST API in Jira Cloud.

GET /rest/agile/1.0/board/\{boardId}/quickfilter/\{quickFilterId}

However this doesn't do me much good – I need the ability to create, modify, and remove them as a result of workflow post actions as this will open up a world of automation possibilities currently not available.  What on earth can I really do by just reading the quickfilters I manually added?

Proposing:

*Create:*

POST /rest/agile/1.0/board/\{boardId}/quickfilter/

{ "name": "Bugs", "jql": "issueType = bug", "description": "Issues of type bug", "position": 0 }

Required: Name, Jql

Responds with 201 plus full quickfilter object if successful:


{ "id": <id>, "boardId": <boardId>, "name": "Bugs", "jql": "issueType = bug", "description": "Issues of type bug", "position": 0 } 

Responds with, 400 if syntax is bad or position is impossible or Name is not unique (or even better, if jql is invalid), or 404 if boardid is not found, plus additional standard errors like 401 and 403

If position is not specified, is added to the end of the current list.  If specified and is beyond the end of the list, error.  If specified and another filter is taking that position, insert at that position displacing the others.

*Update:*
PUT /rest/agile/1.0/board/\{boardId}/quickfilter/\{quickfilterid}

{ "name": "Bugs", "jql": "issueType = bug", "description": "Issues of type bug", "position": 0 }


Responds with 200 plus full quickfilter object if successful:


{ "id": <id>, "boardId": <boardId>, "name": "Bugs", "jql": "issueType = bug", "description": "Issues of type bug", "position": 0 } 

Responds with, 400 if syntax is bad or position is impossible or Name is not unique (or even better, if jql is invalid), or 404 if boardid is not found, plus additional standard errors like 401 and 403

If position is not specified, it stays where it is.  If specified and is beyond the end of the list, error.  If specified and another filter is taking that position, insert at that position displacing the others.  When removed from its original position other filters shift left.

 

*Delete:*

/rest/agile/1.0/board/\{boardId}/quickfilter/\{quickfilterid}

Responds with 204 if successful, 404 if not found.  Positions of remaining quickfilters shift left.

 

*Move:*

Semantics similar to "[Reorder custom field options (context)|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/platform/rest/v3/api-group-issue-custom-field-options/#api-rest-api-3-field-fieldid-context-contextid-option-move-put]"



PUT /rest/agile/1.0/board/\{boardId}/quickfilter/move

{quickFilterIds: <Array <String>>, after: <position string>, position: <"First" | "Last">

204 if successful
400 if both after and position are specified, or if after refers to a bad position, or if any quickFilterIds are not found in board marked by boardId, or if a quickfilterId is listed more than once

Other errors like 404, 401, 403 as appropriate.
fields.summary: Add, Modify, Delete, and Move quick filters via REST API

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Advanced Roadmaps user set as View Restricted has access to the Configuration screen, and they can try to edit any field but once they try to save it, they get a loop spinning wheel until they refresh the browser the changes will not take effect
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Add a user to the "View" Restricted configuration of a plan
 # Get the user to access the configuration screen of the plan, make a change and save

h3. Expected Results
Users should have read-only access to the configurations so they should know if they need to ask a Jira Admin to make changes based on their daily operations
h3. Actual Results
They can access and make changes to the fields, but if they try to save the change they get a spinning wheel that will not go away, only by refreshing the browser

h3. Workaround
Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Advanced Roadmaps user set as View Restricted has access to the Configuration screen

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
If you have an issue opened on Full Issue view and you click on Backlog to create a new issue, the backlog does not auto-refresh it when you create the issue. 

Instead, it displays a message:
{quote}
"Your Issue ABC-123 has been created but is not currently visible"
{quote}

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Access the issue <instance.atlassian.net/browse/ABC122>
# Click on the Backlog on the sidebar and try to create an issue

h3. Expected Results
Backlog should auto-refresh to display the new issue

h3. Actual Results
Backlog just display the message:
{quote}
"Your Issue ABC-123 has been created but is not currently visible"
{quote}

h3. Workaround
* Click at Sprint, the sidebar, and then click on the Backlog again
* Create another issue after the message. Both tickets will appear on the Backlog. After that, the auto-refresh will occur as expected.
fields.summary: Accessing Backlog from Jira issue and creating an issue does not auto-refresh the Backlog

fields.description:
I have just spent a couple of hours moving issues around. This has involved moving issues (tasks) to sub-tasks and sub-tasks to tasks and a few times to different projects.

This has been really convoluted and annoying.

I might want to move just one issue but I have to go through 4 screens to do it. It would be ideal if I could just drag and drop issues into other issues to make them sub-taks.

We often just create issues as we come across them and then need to organise them.

It's like User Story Mapping. I have a whole stack of issues that could effectively be on post-it notes. I'm talking development tasks here though rather than user stories.

There really has to be a simpler way to do this.
fields.summary: Simplify moving issues

fields.summary: Ability to copy Workflow to new Team Managed projects

fields.description:
When I press the "Enter" *one* time, I expect to get *one* Carriage Return / Line Feed.

So why is it when I press the "Enter" key *one* time, I get essentially *two* Carriage Return / Line feed?

And if I want only *one* Carriage Return / Line Feed, why do I have to press *two* keys Shift + Enter?

This makes no sense.

If I want one CRLF, I press Enter once.
If I want two CRLF, I press Enter twice.

Why do you have to make this so stupidly complex?
fields.summary: Pressing the "Enter" key is One Carriage Return Line Feed

If I want to use your super awesome automagical numbered list feature, I'll use the super convenient CTRL+Shift+7.
fields.summary: Disable Super Awesome Automagical Numbering or Numbered List

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

If I filter issues per one assignee (john) on the board and reassign all issues from this assignee (john) to another user (mary), the option to filter through this assignee (john) disappears on the quick filters, however, the board is still filtering by them (john).
 [^Screen+Recording+2021-06-28+at+03.07.25+PM.mp4] 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Have issues assigned to one user
 # Quick filter on the board to only see issues assigned to this one user
 # While the filter is active, change the assignee on the issues to another user
 # The issues will vanish from the board (as there are no issues assigned to this one user)
 # The quick filter option to filter through this one user also vanishes
 # The board is still filtering by this one user, though they are no longer a filter option

h3. Expected Results
Although there are no issues to be seen on the board, as the board is still filtering by that one user, it should show as a filter. 

h3. Actual Results
The board shows as empty and having no filters applied to it (but there is).

h3. Workaround

Manually click Clear filters to remove all filters from the board or refresh the page
fields.summary: Filtering issues per assignee on team-managed projects and reassigning all issues makes assignee disappear from quick filter while parameter still applied on the board

fields.description:
Please make the Kanban quick filter dropdown settings configurable or use some responsive design elements to only show when a user has a small screen. The current forced setting of "5 or more filters goes in a dropdown" causes unneeded navigation and clicking for users with large screens.

 

This is caused by JSWCLOUD-16351...
fields.summary: Quick filter dropdown

fields.description: Currently, it's only possible to see the last 10-11 sprints on the report. It would be awesome to be able to view all sprints that were already closed.
